author: Special Correspondent
text:
The State-wide agitation by members of the Joint Action Council of Tamil Nadu Teachers’ Organisations (JACTTO) entered the third day on Monday with more teachers courting arrest in hundreds in Thanjavur, Tiruvarur, and Nagapattinam districts to highlight their 15-point charter of demands. In many government schools, the agitating teachers locked up the school premises as a mark of protest.

Demands

Major demands of the JACTTO, included scrapping of the Contributory Pension Scheme, salary on a par with the Union government teachers, regularisation of services of those teachers recruited in 2003 as on that date, implementation of Tamil-medium education, addressing wage disparities, implementation of the old pension scheme for all, extending pension to vocational group teachers, nomination of welfare officer to implement schemes in schools, nomination of physical training teachers based on seniority and opposed any move to close down primary schools.

In Thanjavur, more than 750 JACTTO members were arrested when they attempted to take out a rally near the Thanjavur Railway Junction area.

In Tiruvarur, more than 1,900 JACTTO members, including 1,200 women teachers who tried to gherao the Collectorate were arrested.

Most schools remained closed and even when they were open, classes were not conducted.

In Nagapattinam district, 1,600 members of the JACTTO who staged a demonstration in front of the district collectorate were arrested.
title: Teachers continue their agitation
